channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Coronavirus cases breach 80,000 with 2,110 new patients
item.description: It has been 131 days since enhanced community quarantine was first implemented in March, and though the Philippines is under the world's longest quarantine, thousands of coronavirus cases are still being recorded each day, with health authorities logging x more on Sunday, bringing the national caseload to x.

item.title: DOTr questions credibility of Ateneo experts' warning vs 'high-risk' infra projects
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "The proponents of PPP are in the best position to assess the viabilities of their investments, not the 'Ateneo Experts'," the department said.

item.title: CHR calls out agencies for 'lack of transparency' on conditions in prisons
item.description: "Public interest in the face of alleged deaths of high-profile inmates due to COVID-19, necessitates disclosure of relevant information about their deaths—both in the interest of justice, as well as in crafting sensible ways forward in preventing further deaths in prisons and detention facilities," the commission said.

item.title: ‘SONA to bring hope of better future’
item.description: President Duterte’s fifth State of the Nation Address tomorrow will bring hope for a better future despite the challenges Filipinos are facing due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Sen. Bong Go said yesterday.

item.title: Duterte won’t submit 2021 budget during SONA – DBM
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: President Duterte is not expected to submit to Congress the proposed national budget for 2021 tomorrow, when he delivers his fifth State of the Nation Address as Congress resumes session, the Department of Budget and Management said over the weekend.

item.title: Isko leads groundbreaking for Manila Zoo rehabilitation
item.description: Manila City Mayor Isko Moreno yesterday led the groundbreaking for the construction of the Bagong Manila Zoo to revive and redevelop the animal park.

item.title: Groups to hold rally at UP during SONA
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Despite the ban imposed by the Department of the Interior and Local Government on mass gatherings, 17 organizations led by labor groups would hold tomorrow at the University of the Philippines in Quezon City protest actions dubbed SONAgkaisa to denounce the administration as President Duterte delivers his 5th State of the Nation Address.

item.title: House sets 3-step strategy for economic recovery
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House is planning to pass three measures to accelerate the nation’s economic recovery from recession caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: MVP to increase COVID-19 bed allocations in his hospitals
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Business tycoon Manny V. Pangilinan has agreed to increase the bed allocation of hospitals nationwide under Metro Pacific Hospital Holdings Inc. for COVID-19 patients from 20 percent to 30 percent, the Department of Heath announced yesterday.

item.title: More lawmakers back plenary vote for ABS-CBN franchise
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: More lawmakers have joined the move to bring the battle of the ABS-CBN franchise to the House plenary.
